name: Hotel Villa La Tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night, I would of liked to of stayed longer. On arrival we were offered a glass of wine or juice, then shown to our room. It was on the third floor, a traditional room with a small balcony. The room was decorated in yellow flowers and soundproof walls. The bathroom was spotless with soap and shampoo and hairdryer. A small bottle of wine and two bottles of water were provided too. There is a small roof terrace with a table and chairs.For the price of this hotel in Nice I think it is a bargain and I would go back there again.
reviews.title: Excellent for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved our two night stay at this hotel. First of all, I cannot say enough good things about Sondra, the receptionist that checked us in and also assisted us multiple times over our stay. She was fluent in English but was patient with me as I practiced ma française and had a lively and funny personality--she was simply wonderful.
reviews.title: Tres bien!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel itself is your standard, European hotel, which I love. The only noise that we heard was from the outside, but you have to expect that when you are in a hotel that is in a prime and central location in the middle of old Nice. For the location, I don't think you can beat the cleanliness of the rooms and the price. Anytime we came through reception, whether at 4 in the afternoon or 4 in the morning (as it was when we left to catch our train), we were asked if we needed any help finding anything and given whatever we needed to go about our trip. It is close to both bus transportation and the tram--we had no problems getting around the old city as well as going up to the Museé de Chagall. I would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Hotel Villa La tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is rather overpriced for what it offers. The best thing about it is the location - in the medieval part of the city. However the rooms are extremely small and cluttered. The walls are extremely thin so you can hear people in the next room chatting. Some of the receptionists are rather unhelpful. There was a small safe in the room which I couldn't get to work and the attitude from receptionist was, well I don't know anything about them... and similar response to one or two other things. Also the radiators don't work so in early spring the room was freezing.
reviews.title: Cosy small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very lovely hotel and a great location in the old town of Nice. Staff was helpful and we got flexible service, because our room was first too high (too much stairs to walk for my mother) but after one night we got a lovely room from the first floor.
reviews.title: perfectly placed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in this small hotel, perfectly located in the old part of Nice, amongst the cobbled streets lined with shops and restaurants. The owner was very friendly, greeting us with a welcoming glass of wine and offering local advice whenever we asked for it. The room was situated on the 2nd floor, up a fairly narrow staircase (may present a bit of a challenge for the less mobile) - the room was fairly small and basic but fully adequate (bed, shower, TV) and with a small balcony. Being in the heart of the busy old town meant that there was a bit of noise early in the morning as shops opened, trams started, etc but the location's pluses outweighed these minor distractions. Definitely recommended for anyone who wants to sample an authentic Nice hotel without breaking the bank.
reviews.title: Small hotel with authentic French charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charming, friendly and welcoming and close to all the main sights, this is the place for romantics who like a bit of character and are not over-fussy. We were 3 flights up a narrow staircase in a small (but attractively decorated and en-suite) room but found it delightful. Breakfast is excellent and better value than the local cafes. Only downside was the noise at night from the bats below. Good value overall.
reviews.title: Shabby/chic in the old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Villa la Tour. We selected the hotel for its location, and we were not disappointed. it was wonderful to be able to leave our room and be steps away from the lively, narrow streets of view Nice, or from the Place Giribaldi. Yes, the room was small, and there were some stains on the rug, but the bed was very comfortable, we had a small balcony and for the most part the staff was very helpful and friendly. We did not have breakfast at the hotel - we chose instead to save a few euros and have breakfast at a cafe.
reviews.title: A few nights in vieux Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here when we had originally booked two (and we were so glad to have cancelled the second night). The hotel charged us a fee to cancel the night, even though we had given 2 days notice.
reviews.title: Did we stay in the right hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located in the old city and very close to the tram and airport bus, the beach is only a short walk away. There was a few dodgy people lurking around at night, but we did not find this or the street noise to be a concern. The staff were very helpful and nice, but...
reviews.title: Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was looking for a hotel with character in the old town of Nice, and this little hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff were lovely: genuinely kind and welcoming, and always ready to help with travel information and suggestions. Breakfast was generous and healthful and prepared personally, in a nicely decorated reception room with additional café tables outside. The building itself is situated in the old city, with all its charm, yet only a couple of minutes walk from the buses and trams, and within easy walking distance of the old chateau (on a hill with amazing views of the city and the waterfront) and the port. The rooms may be small, but that is what one expects in a vintage hotel in the old part of the city. And besides, you don't need much space in your room if you are out-and-about enjoying the city!
reviews.title: Charming setting and a very welcoming staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I accept that it is only two stars and that the prices are relatively low (for Nice) at around £75 for a standard double but I thought it felt a little neglected. Cleaning standards could be better.
reviews.title: Shabby yes, chic no.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most bizarre thing was a flimsy net curtain that offered no privacy from the apartments directly opposite.
reviews.title: Very basic (but doesn't claim otherwise) - good location - nice staff.
Excellent service, perfect for our needs
reviews.text: External noise was a problem one night, local youths until around 5am! No fault of the hotel though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No tea or coffee in the room just a bottle of water at 1.5 euros which I passed on, as I did for the 8 euro breakfast.
reviews.title: In the heart of old town Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our third stay in the Villa la Tour at the end of holidays in the area to enable easy access to airport buses. It has always been ideal--situated in the rambling streets of the old town and with lovely views over the area from a little rooftop terrace, an ideal place for an evening drink. Rooms are a little small and staircases steep due to the age of the building but beds are comfortable and we had a newly refurbished bathroom. Also our own little balcony overlooking a popular wine bar over the road. It is an easy walk to reach the castle, flower market, beaches etc and many delightful reastaurants. Breakfast looked varied and delicious though we didn't have it ourselves. Staff were as usual charming and helpful.
reviews.title: Another happy stay!
If you want to be in Old Town
reviews.text: Our room was clean, the bathroom was newish, staff was helpful, breakfast was good. With the windows closed the room was fairly quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 3rd floor is 62 steps from the lobby and there is no one to help you with the luggage.
reviews.title: Great location in old Nice, lovely staff, good room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to the tram and to the bus stop that takes you to see the Chagall and Matisse Museums. If you want a beach hotel you should stay closer to the Promenade de Anglais.
reviews.title: Just wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The old town does have restaurants, bakeries, etc., but also many many cheap souvenir, t-shirt, etc. stores.
reviews.title: Average; quaint, small, shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is indeed in a convenient location. Part of the old town, near trams, antique district and Garibaldi Square stores. Picked it because of the location and pleased with that part. Tiny, pretty room. Had breakfast the first day -- out of four. You sat at a long rectangular table with other guests. No one talked much. Turned out that cold cuts and cheese were outside the front door so not obviously available. Staff was friendly, made phone calls and answered questions, but didn't offer any drinks to me. Even though there was a bottle of water in the room it was accompanied by a note stating the price.
reviews.title: Good location, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mainly, the controller or the unit for heat never worked properly. Since it was winter, I was just cold most of the time in my room. They sometimes got it to work but the next time I turned it on--no heat. No heat in the bathroom unless the door was open. There was heat in reception and adjoining breakfast area. Just a mystery.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in January 2012 based on recommendations on Trip Advisor and were very pleased. Staff members were extremely congenial, location was ideal, price was reasonable and room was more than adequate. Since there is no elevator, persons who can't climb stairs may not want to stay here, but that should be the only deterrent. We were even contacted promptly by the manager as we left our credit card in the safe. She saved us a lot of grief. Will definitely stay here again if we return to Nice.
reviews.title: An excellent little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very welcoming.
reviews.title: Conveniently located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at around 9pm to be greeted by a lovely receptionist. She showed us to our room and provided a free drink too. We were lucky to have a front facing with balcony however, we did send the hotel a request for this some time ago. The room is a little small, but clean and tidy. Your not in there long enough, just out exploring. We never had the breakfast so can't comment.
reviews.title: Very pleasant place to stay in Old Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved Hotel la Tour. It is one of the only hotels in Vieux Nice (the car-free pedestrian area with historic buildings and cobblestone streets) It's a 10 minute walk to the beach and right near the regional bus station - very convenient for day trips.
reviews.title: Best deal in Nice

likes.disliked: — Little room - but even that wasn't that bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The owner is extremely nice and helpful (great restaurant suggestion for a special birthday dinner) and definitley tried her best to make sure our stay was good.
reviews.title: A pleasant boutique hotel in the old town area of Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was the inexpensive interior room with a window over a courtyard. The room was miniscule - not for some people but we are used to hostelling and budget hotels, and for the price it's what we expected. We spent almost no time in the room so the size wasnt' a problem. You should note, though, that even this budget room had good adjustable air conditioning - unusual for this type of room in europe.
reviews.title: All you need!
Friendly, quiet hotel
reviews.text: There was a great rooftop terrace where we had a picnic breakfast every day (get fruit from market, hit the bakery and get yogurts from the grocery store which is like a block away).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price, being able to stay in such a good location in Nice was worth the small room. If you can afford the larger room, that's really ideal. This is a great area of Nice that is relaxing and tourist friendly while still having local flavor (lines outside the butcher on the next block remind you real French people live here - not like some places in Paris where it's all tourists)
reviews.title: Boho-Chic in Old Town Nice

likes.liked: — Value for money and its great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel, small but perfectly placed for seeing the city, walking to the Promenade des Anglais, catching a bus or tram and meandering round the 'Old Town' or port. The staff are friendly and welcoming and all speak excellent English. The rooms are very good - not huge - but more than adequate and well appointed. I would definitely go back. I just wish that it had been more obvious that you could buy a glass of wine there.
reviews.title: short break in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First time in Nice and would definately visit again! Weather great and lots to see. Hotel situated in the Old town and easy reached with the 98 bus from the airport. Picked the Hotel after studying lots of reviews, which were spot on. The rooms are adequate and would call 'shabby chique'. Shower was superbe even though I prefer a bath. Up on the 3rd floor which has a steep, narrow staircase, so not for those with waking dificulties. Only downside I could mention was the lack of tea making facilities in the room - would have been a very welcome addition.Staff friendly and supplied welcome glass of wine on arrival and were helpful with directions and sites. Breakfast was buffet and only one long table for all to sit at which was a little uncomfortable if you area little shy - only had one morning. For a 2 star great hotel in great location.
reviews.title: surprised us on lots of fronts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed in Villa la Tour for two nights on a budget France trip. We got their cheapest room, which is a TINY full bed room with a shower stall, toilet and sink (in the room, not seperated by a wall or anything- so make sure you are with someone you are VERY comfortable with!). This room, however was really really cute, and the bed was VERY comfortable. Everything was so clean. There was some water damage to the ceiling, but that was about it. For the price, I wasn't worried about it. There was even an air conditioner, which was great because our window opened up over the "courtyard" which was actually where all of the hotel's laundry facilities were set up, so there was alot of laundry smells through the window, if left open. The reception area is lovely and the staff is extremely friendly! We didn't try the breakfast, but it looked like a nice breakfast area. The location of the hotel, although just barely in what is considered the original old town of Nice, is still right next to alot of the action. The Meditteranean sea is a 10 minute walk.
reviews.title: Great Place!

likes.liked: — The nicer than average hotel room for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a month in S. France. Our best hotel of the trip and best breakfast.Highly recommended. Barbara, the owner, will see you are well taken care of. Air conditioning(cooling) was turned on and working.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Old Nice

likes.liked: — Cooling air conditioner had digital thermostat to select room temp.

reviews.title: Extra Nice
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Each room is individually decorated - ours was clean and spacious, with a newly renovated ensuite bathroom. They are affiliated with a private beach, and will provide you with beach umbrellas and mats free of charge. It's about a 15 minute walk to the beach, a perfect distance to have a leisurely walk and duck into some of the lovely French shops along the way. We didn't have the buffet breakfast they served, but it looked tasty and was relatively inexpensive. We'd definitely recommend this hotel without reservation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel was recommended to me by my partner who stayed there during the winter. I was glad to have accepted the recommendation.
reviews.title: A Great Place in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's easy to find--just across the way from the bus station--and the location is great--Vieux Nice at the doorstep, and just a short walk to the port and the antique stores in that area.
reviews.title: Warm place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 7 nights and had a great time. Our first night we had a very small room with the shower and toilet in the room. We knew we would be in this room (the price was right) and the other 6 nights we had a larger room with a balcony. The room was clean, comfortable. Staff were great, very helpful, local area fantastic for shopping and eating. Laundry about 50 mts away. Had the hotel breakfast 3 mornings which was great. Walked to the beach each day, weather fantastic. We had a wonderful experience at Villa La Tour, and will be back. The website is acurate with the description of the Hotel, local area etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Villa La Tour for 7nights. Expecting a small hotel with good service and a few decorative faults with French style, we got exactly this.
reviews.title: Excellent Little Hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing, but being picky rooms bit small (as expected).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff / service were perfect and a bench mark for any hotel no-matter what the size / cost.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in old Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: The rooms were small but clean and with a few minor decorative faults (as expected). We got a two bed room which was small but easily adequate with a clean bathroom. The location is perfect for the bus station as approx 75metres away. The train station is a 15min walk or you can get a bus. Although when the tram system is complete you will be able to get a tram straight to the train station.
reviews.title: Great location, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in the old town and a short walk to the beachfront.
reviews.title: Great place!

likes.liked: — The wonderful owner and workers there, the location
likes.disliked: — The water damage on the wall...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has probably the best, friendliest staff of any hotel ive ever stayed at. they were all absolutely wonderful. and this is why i have rated our stay there as above average. if it hadnt been for the staff, i would have been a bit underwhelmed by this hotel. on the positive side, apart from the great team, the hotel is very well located in the old part of nice very close to the beaches, public transport and streets and streets of great restaurants. the tiny roof top terrace is also lovely. the rooms were also very sweet if a little home spun. i guess this is why i was a little underwhelmed by the hotel. from its website and reviews i'd read in other publications i was expecting somewhere a little more polished and little more boutique. in the event, its more like staying at a friend's place who has a bent for home decorating and has experimented in different ways in different rooms. aestetics aside, my only serious gripe was that even though we were staying in one of the most expensive rooms the bathroom was impossibly small and i couldnt actually fit in the shower and move at the same time and im only of an average size. the airconditioning worked well which was great as it was hot during our stay. the only other thing to note is that there is no lift so if you have mobility issues or arent confident about carrying luggage up several flights of stairs maybe not for you. overall then, the friendliest hotel in the world but definitely on the home spun side of the spectrum. but at the end of day, value, friendliness and location count for a lot.
reviews.title: The staff make this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all. This is not a luxury Hotel and it´s very small. But as many other stated, it´s has a lot of charm and also superb staff. The location is perfect and if you are looking for a non expensive Hotel in the old part of Nice, this is a good choice.
reviews.title: Small charming Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: Me, my sister and her daughter invited our mother/grandmother to Nice as a present for her 70th birthday she had a couple of months ago. We found Villa la Tour on the net and booked it for 4 nights. When we came to Nice we saw it was the perfect place for us. A friendly, clean and quiet place located in the old town. The rooms had TV, good showers etc. A few minutes walk and we were at the beach. When we wanted to take the bus to Monaco the busstation was just two minutes walk away. The cosy hotel with friendly staff in a good location made it the perfect place to stay. And with prices below most other hotels I know for sure that if I visit Nice another time I know were to stay !
reviews.title: All what we needed in the old town of Nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I am so glad I spent so much time reading reviews on TripAdvisor when searching for the perfect place for my solo vacation. Barbara and her staff are wonderful! The hotel is in the perfect place for walking to anywhere in Old Town, the Promenade, Place Massena, the bus station, etc. The nicely decorated room and bathroom were small but not cramped. I am very particular about hotels rooms, sheets, pillows, water pressure, sound levels, etc, and I cannot find one thing to complain about. However, please go with the understanding that the road by the hotel is still under construction so you have to watch where you are walking on the way to the bus station. It is possible when staying here to become part of the neighborhood and suddenly wish you didn't have to leave. This hotel is for single travelers or couples, I would not recommend it for children. I will defintely go back next year.
reviews.title: Perfect for me!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Hotel la Tour for 3 nights on a 3-week tour of Provence. On this trip we made more effort than usual to select our hotels for their ambiance and location, in addition to cleanliness and reasonable price. Although the rooms were not decorated as nicely as indicated by its Website, it was clean, comfortable, very convenient, located in an interesting setting, and had friendly staff. The small friendly wine bar facing the hotel made a pleasant place to relax after a day of sightseeing, and a great patisserie is just around the corner.
reviews.title: The Only hotel in Old Nice!

description: Originating from part of an 18th century convent, Hotel Villa La Tour offers the charm of Southern France in an exclusive location. In the heart of the old part of Nice, near the colourful flower market, the port, museums, opera, bistros and shops. Only 10 minutes’ walk to the beach. 17 individually furnished rooms offering modern facilities: shower, WC, hair dryer, telephone with PC attachment, air condition, free wifi connection satellite TV and a personal safe; some with a small balcony.
